article_title: VW Battery Partner QuantumScape to List After Blank-Check Deal
article_text: LISTEN TO ARTICLE    2:39      SHARE THIS ARTICLE   Share   Tweet   Post   Email  {"contentId":"QG2451T0AFBS01","position":"brokerboxarticle","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[120,60]],"small_desktop":[[120,60]],"tablet":[[120,60]]},"strategy":"viewable","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"brokerboxarticle1","url":"/news/articles/2020-09-03/vw-battery-partner-quantumscape-to-list-after-blank-check-deal"},"containerId":"brokerboxarticle-6Nnqh6A"}   Sign up to receive the Green Daily daily newsletter and follow us @climate.    QuantumScape Corp., the technology developer that’s partnering with Volkswagen AG on advanced electric-car batteries, will list in New York after merging with blank-check company Kensington Capital Acquisition Corp.    {"contentId":"QG2451T0AFBS01","position":"outstream","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[1,8]],"small_desktop":[[1,8]],"tablet":[[1,8]]},"strategy":"always","type":"Outstream Video Native Ad","targeting":{"position":"outstream","url":"/news/articles/2020-09-03/vw-battery-partner-quantumscape-to-list-after-blank-check-deal"},"containerId":"outstream-video-1-QG2451T0AFBS01"}   {"contentId":"QG2451T0AFBS01","position":"outstream","dimensions":{"mobile":[[1,8]]},"strategy":"always","type":"Outstream Video Native Ad","targeting":{"position":"outstream","url":"/news/articles/2020-09-03/vw-battery-partner-quantumscape-to-list-after-blank-check-deal"},"containerId":"outstream-video-2-QG2451T0AFBS01"}     Explore dynamic updates of the earth’s key data points       Open the Data Dash     Close           {"contentId":"QG2451T0AFBS01","position":"greensponsoredby","dimensions":{"small_desktop":[[190,31]],"large_desktop":[[190,31]],"tablet":[[190,31]],"mobile":[[190,31]]},"positionIncrement":2,"targeting":{"position":"greensponsoredby2","positionIncrement":2,"url":"/news/articles/2020-09-03/vw-battery-partner-quantumscape-to-list-after-blank-check-deal"},"containerId":"greensponsoredby-5azLAPO"}   The deal will raise about $700 million for QuantumScape, including $500 million from Fidelity Management & Research Co. LLC and Janus Henderson Investors as it begins trading on the New York Stock Exchange, according to a statement Thursday. The combined company will be valued at about $3.3 billion, including debt.    {"contentId":"QG2451T0AFBS01","position":"box","dimensions":{"mobile":[[300,250],[3,3],[1,1],"fluid"]},"type":"Mobile Body Box Ad","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"box1","positionIncrement":1,"url":"/news/articles/2020-09-03/vw-battery-partner-quantumscape-to-list-after-blank-check-deal"},"containerId":"box-xKXe1xk"}   The transaction underscores investor interest in emerging electric-vehicle technologies amid forecasts for sharply rising consumer demand. It also marks the latest in a surge of back-door listings onto public exchanges via special purpose acquisition companies (SPACs), which have become a fast-growing alternative to traditional initial public offerings.     More from       Nikola Can Go It Alone If Deal With GM Crumbles, CEO Says      California Braces for Another Day of Heat, Wind and Wildfires      South Africa to Allow Municipalities to Source Their Own Power      The IMF Has a Blueprint for Helping the Climate Without Hurting Economic Growth    Kensington, led by former executives from carmarkers including General Motors Co. and Chrysler Group LLC, raised about $200 million in June to focus on acquisitions in the North American auto sector. Shares of Kensington Capital Acquisition Corp. rose as much as 74% on Thursday.  {"contentId":"QG2451T0AFBS01","position":"desktop-in-article1","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[5,4]],"small_desktop":[[5,4]]},"type":"Desktop in article Native Ad","targeting":{"position":"desktop-in-article1","url":"/news/articles/2020-09-03/vw-battery-partner-quantumscape-to-list-after-blank-check-deal"},"containerId":"desktop-in-article-1-QG2451T0AFBS01"}   “This vote of confidence from investors, and the capital provided by this transaction, will drive a more sustainable future for generations to come,” said Jagdeep Singh, founder and CEO of QuantumScape. The deal means the developer will be fully funded to the start of battery production in the VW venture, which the partners have previously said could be as soon as 2023.  QuantumScape, founded a decade ago by former Stanford University researchers, is a developer of solid-state batteries, an advance on existing lithium-ion cell technology that promises to pack in more energy to extend driving range, lower costs, improve safety and cut recharging times to as little as 15 minutes from several hours.  To read more about solid-state batteries, click here  {"contentId":"QG2451T0AFBS01","position":"in-article1","dimensions":{"mobile":[[5,19],[300,250],[3,3],[1,1],"fluid"],"tablet":[[5,11],[728,90],[1,1]]},"type":"In Article Flex Native Ad","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"in-article1","positionIncrement":1,"url":"/news/articles/2020-09-03/vw-battery-partner-quantumscape-to-list-after-blank-check-deal"},"containerId":"in-article-1-QG2451T0AFBS01"}   The firm’s technology, along with other industry developments, are key to delivering cheaper and better batteries that will make electric models a “realistic option for every car owner,” Bill Gates said in a blog post last month. The Gates-backed Breakthrough Energy Ventures is an investor in QuantumScape.  QuantumScape’s technology “represents the most elegant architecture I’ve seen for a lithium-based battery system, and the company has an opportunity to redefine the battery landscape,” J.B. Straubel, the Tesla Inc. co-founder who sits on the developer’s board, said in the statement.  The deal isn’t the first SPAC merger in the electric-vehicle sector. Nikola Corp. went public on the Nasdaq bourse in June through a merger with an entity led by former GM executives called VectoIQ Acquisition Corp.  — With assistance by Crystal Kim  (Adds shares line in fourth paragraph, updates headline)   Published on ‎3‎ ‎September‎, ‎2020‎ ‎12‎:‎30  Updated on  ‎3‎ ‎September‎, ‎2020‎ ‎16‎:‎05        Have a confidential tip for our reporters?
